The fact is, high school and middle school kids are getting their hands on these products setting them up for a lifetime of nicotine addiction and negative health side effects. This is about the health of our children.

I believe information and education on these new and complex treatments for providers and patients will lead to healthy competition in the biologic and biosimilar product space, and ultimately help to lower the cost of these important drugs for patients.

With an offering of enticing flavors, vaping is attracting teens who might not otherwise have exposure to nicotine. I support the Trump Administration’s proposal to combat the epidemic of youth e-cigarette use by banning flavored options from the marketplace.

As a cardiothoracic surgeon and father of four kids, I am deeply troubled by the increasing rate of e-cigarette use among our children. The long-term negative health implications of nicotine use on the heart and entire cardiovascular system are well known. https://t.co/tbcKTVW5xg

Thanks to the Department of Health and Human Services, the Hamilton Center in Terre Haute will be receiving more than $1 million to bolster their Head Start Program. These hard-earned taxpayer dollars are much-needed resources that will help young Hoosiers. #HereForHoosiers https://t.co/qMqIO2PdtY

Recently, I voted to reauthorize multiple public health care bills that benefit Hoosiers across the state.  These programs play a vital role in our communities and address the health care needs of the most vulnerable Americans. #HereForHoosiers https://t.co/nKBV2TG3os

and rooting out white supremacist terrorism – no differently than we have dealt with the threat of radical Islamic terrorism – & by improving access to mental health care & confronting the underlying glorification of violence that is unfortunately the norm in our culture today.

Today in the House Energy & Commerce Committee we unanimously passed the No Surprises Act – to end surprise medical bills. Through payment dispute resolution between the provider and health plan, we can ensure patients are not unfairly financially burdened for out of network care https://t.co/1yCGugOXku

By providing a fair process for health plans and providers to settle payment disputes through a dispute resolution process this legislation protects patients from the financial burden of surprise medical bills.

President Trump’s EO is an important step to increase transparency in health care. As a physician, I am pleased that we are moving in a direction that allows consumers to better understand the cost of care they are receiving earlier in the process.

https://t.co/Pz3bgHugUa https://t.co/b3kUeXUPwa

My office partnered with USDA Rural Development and other federal and state agencies to present a symposium today on resources of importance to area counties and rural communities. My thanks to Gibson General Hospital for hosting  this informative program in Princeton. https://t.co/kxX8Fjw5Um

Yesterday, I toured the Genoa Healthcare Pharmacy in Evansville. They are a leading example of patient centered care; from their discrete building for patient comfort, to hand loaded monthly peel pack medications that have led to 96% medication adherence, they are leading the way https://t.co/44A3BC1DOz

This weekend I joined my fellow Hoosiers for the 2018 Walk to end Alzheimer’s event in Terre Haute. In remarks to the crowd I outlined my recent votes to increase funding for the National Institutes of Health in support of research efforts to end this disease. #Walk2EndAlz https://t.co/nAGCdVDzP2

Hydropower provides benefits in the form of jobs, economic investment, improved public health, and resource conservation. It’s also a great source of American-made energy. In the 8th district, there are six non-powered dams that could be modernized to produce clean energy. https://t.co/zWwzXuu4W3

State Representative Dr. Tim Brown has become a great friend since our state wide healthcare policy tour together in 2014. I was saddened to hear of his recent accident and my thoughts and prayers are with Tim, his family and his friends. Get well soon!

As part of #NationalHealthCenterWeek I stopped by the Wabash Valley Community Health Center’s Community Appreciation luncheon and met with several volunteers and patients of the health center. As a Federally Qualified Health Center, it’s nice to see the positive impact it has. https://t.co/FRK0TJ0yDZ

As a former cardiovascular & thoracic surgeon, it’s always nice getting back into the hospital setting for a visit. The new Heart and Vascular Institute at @myunionhealth Hospital is equipped with state-of-the-art equipment and highly skilled physicians right here in Terre Haute https://t.co/CBfuNFgCH0

This morning I rode in the IU lifeline helicopter from Terre Haute airport to @myunionhealth Hospital. It gave me a first-hand experience concerning what first responders do on a daily basis to save lives and ensure injured patients get to trauma centers quickly. https://t.co/rrsyZSEKf2

Today I spoke at the Owen County Economic Development Meeting. We discussed topics important to the District including the tax cuts, healthcare, the repeal of the medial device tax, and the opioid epidemic. Thank you to those that attended & for those that joined me on reporting. https://t.co/3eF4epAsKM

This afternoon I enjoyed speaking to the Vermillion County Chamber of Commerce monthly luncheon in Clinton on a number of issues ranging from #taxcutsandjobsact, healthcare, the #opioidcrisis, and job creation. It’s great to hear from everyone on issues that matter to them. https://t.co/djIHHA3tGK
